Persistent To-Do List is a browser-based task manager that allows users to add, complete, and delete tasks with ease. Completed tasks can be ticked to show a strike-through effect, and tasks persist even if the browser is closed or refreshed.

ğŸš€ Features

  • ğŸ“ Add Tasks: Quickly add new tasks to your list with a clean interface.

  • âœ… Mark Complete: Tick tasks to mark them as done, applying a strike-through style for clarity.

  • âŒ Delete Tasks: Remove unwanted tasks individually using the cross button beside each task.

  • ğŸ’¾ Persistent Storage: Tasks are saved in the browserâ€™s local storage, so they remain available even after closing or reopening the browser.

  • âš¡ Easy to Use: Minimalist UI makes managing your tasks quick and intuitive.

  • ğŸŒ Cross-Browser Compatible: Works on modern browsers without any external dependencies.

Port Scanner is a fast, lightweight, and multi-threaded Python tool for detecting open ports on a target host. Ideal for penetration testers, network admins, and cybersecurity enthusiasts, it provides clean, accurate, and quick scanning results.

ğŸš€ Features

  • âš¡ Multi-threaded Scanning: Quickly scan hundreds of ports using Python's threading for optimal performance.

  • ğŸŒ Domain & IP Support: Scan both domain names and raw IP addresses with ease.

  • ğŸ”Œ TCP & UDP Modes: Perform TCP connect scans or basic UDP probes to check open ports.

  • ğŸ¯ Custom Port Ranges: Specify start and end ports for targeted scans.

  • ğŸ“œ Clean Output: Displays only open ports for clear, concise results.

  • ğŸ’» Cross-Platform: Works seamlessly on Windows, Linux, and macOS.

  • ğŸ”® Future Enhancements: Plans for banner grabbing, protocol-specific scanning, and more advanced network reconnaissance features.

Python Keylogger is a lightweight and cross-platform script built with pynput that captures keystrokes, including modifier combinations like CTRL+K, and saves them into timestamped log files. Intended for educational use, penetration testing, or behavior analysis.

ğŸš€ Features

  • âŒ¨ï¸ Multi-Key Detection: Captures combo keys like CTRL+C, ALT+F4, SHIFT+A.

  • ğŸ—‚ï¸ Timestamped Logs: Automatically saves logs with unique date and time filenames.

  • ğŸ”’ Modifier Handling: Tracks keys like CTRL, SHIFT, ALT accurately.

  • ğŸ§  Smart Character Capture: Supports standard character keys and special keys.

  • ğŸ§¾ Lightweight: Pure Python with minimal dependencies (only pynput).

  • ğŸ“¦ Cross-Platform: Runs on Windows, Linux, and macOS wherever pynput is supported.

URL Analyzer is a lightweight yet powerful Python tool designed to inspect, validate, and flag potentially malicious or suspicious URLs.
Itâ€™s built for cybersecurity researchers, ethical hackers, bug bounty hunters, and anyone who wants to demystify URLs.

Key Features

  • âœ… Subdomain Counter â€“ Analyze and count subdomains from any URL.
  • ğŸŒ Scheme Validation â€“ Flags dangerous or uncommon schemes (ftp://, file://, etc.).
  • âš ï¸ SSRF Risk Detection â€“ Detects access to localhost, internal IPs, or intranet targets.
  • ğŸ“¦ .env Integration â€“ Load API keys and configs securely from environment variables.
  • ğŸ§  ISP Lookup (IPInfo) â€“ Fetch ISP and geo info using IPInfo API.
  • ğŸ¨ Terminal Styling â€“ Color-coded terminal output using termcolor.
  • ğŸ§¹ Auto Clear â€“ Clears terminal screen after errors or interruptions.
  • ğŸ§ª URL Parsing â€“ Dissects scheme, domain, subdomains, port, etc.
  • ğŸ” Input Validation â€“ Handles broken or malformed URLs gracefully.

What's New in v1.1

  • âœ… Graceful fallback for missing IPInfo token â€” continues processing without crashing when no API key is provided.
